required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Combination Chemotherapy for Metastatic Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study of Gemcitabine Plus Cisplatin as First-line Treatment of Metastatic Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the objective tumor response of the first-line therapy combination of gemcitabine and cisplatin in patients with metastatic breast cancer

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease (eight 21-day cycles of therapy and follow-up period was 24 months starting from the date of the last drug administration. Data collected every 4 months.)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: first documented complete or partial response to measured progressive disease (eight 21-day cycles of therapy and follow-up period was 24 months starting from the date of the last drug administration.)
first active treatment dose to measured progressive disease (eight 21-day cycles of therapy and follow-up period was 24 months starting from the date of the last drug administration.)

first active treatment dose to last contact for patients, death as a result of any cause, or early discontinuation of treatment (eight 21-day cycles of therapy and follow-up period was 24 months starting from the date of the last drug administration.)
first active treatment dose to date of death due to any cause (eight 21-day cycles of therapy and follow-up period was 24 months starting from the date of the last drug administration.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Maximum Common Toxicity Criteria-National Cancer Institute Toxicity (CTC-NCI) of Gemcitabine-Cisplatin Combination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after last dose of study drug (eight 21-day cycles of therapy)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Hematology Maximum Common Toxicity Criteria - National Cancer Institute Grades
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after last dose of study drug (eight 21-day cycles of therapy)
Baseline through follow-up (eight 21-day cycles of therapy and follow-up period was 24 months starting from the date of the last drug administration.)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events Leading to Discontinuation

intervention.description: Gemcitabine (30 min intravenous infusion) dose of 1000mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle).
Cisplatin (30-120 min intravenous infusion) dose of 35 mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- You are female in the age of 18 to 75 years old.
- You have been diagnosed with the metastatic breast cancer.
- You have desire and an opportunity to visit your doctor in medical site, both during realization of the active treatment program, and within 24 months of medical follow up.
- You must sign this informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- You are pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Your laboratory parameters fall outside the limits, admitted by requirements of the present clinical study.
- You have been diagnosed with serious concomitant or acute infectious disease.
- You have used experimental medications within the last month.

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon-Fri 9AM - 5PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST),

For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon- Fri from 9AM to 5PM Eastern time (UTC/ GMT - 5hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine (30 min intravenous infusion) dose of 1000mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle). Cisplatin (30-120 min intravenous infusion) dose of 35 mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle).

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine (30 min intravenous infusion) dose of 1000mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle). Cisplatin (30-120 min intravenous infusion) dose of 35 mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle).

measure.title: Stage of Disease at Entry to the Study
measure.description: Stage of disease was determined using American Joint Committee on Cancer Staging Criteria for Breast Cancer. The higher the stage, the more severe the disease.

measure.title: Stage of Disease at Time of Diagnosis
measure.description: Stage of disease was determined using American Joint Committee on Cancer Staging Criteria for Breast Cancer. The higher the stage, the more severe the disease.

measure.title: Time from Initial Diagnosis to Study Entry

outcome.title: Objective Tumor Response
outcome.description: Best response recorded from the start of treatment until disease progression/recurrence using World Health Organization (WHO) criteria that defines when participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatment.
outcome.time_frame: baseline to measured progressive disease (eight 21-day cycles of therapy and follow-up period was 24 months starting from the date of the last drug administration. Data collected every 4 months.)
outcome.population: Efficacy Population: all enrolled participants who received study drug; did not have more than one neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; had measurable disease; had prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; and did not have prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease.

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine (30 min intravenous infusion) dose of 1000mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle). Cisplatin (30-120 min intravenous infusion) dose of 35 mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle).

measure.title: Objective Tumor Response
measure.description: Best response recorded from the start of treatment until disease progression/recurrence using World Health Organization (WHO) criteria that defines when participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatment.
measure.population: Efficacy Population: all enrolled participants who received study drug; did not have more than one neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; had measurable disease; had prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; and did not have prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease.

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: The duration of a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) was defined as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of progression or death as a result of any cause.
outcome.time_frame: first documented complete or partial response to measured progressive disease (eight 21-day cycles of therapy and follow-up period was 24 months starting from the date of the last drug administration.)
outcome.population: Response population: all enrolled participants who had either a complete or partial response.

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine (30 min intravenous infusion) dose of 1000mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle). Cisplatin (30-120 min intravenous infusion) dose of 35 mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle).

measure.title: Duration of Response
measure.description: The duration of a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) was defined as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of progression or death as a result of any cause.
measure.population: Response population: all enrolled participants who had either a complete or partial response.

outcome.title: Time to Progressive Disease
outcome.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first date of disease progression.
outcome.time_frame: first active treatment dose to measured progressive disease (eight 21-day cycles of therapy and follow-up period was 24 months starting from the date of the last drug administration.)
outcome.population: Efficacy Population: all enrolled participants who received study drug; did not have more than one neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; had measurable disease; had prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; and did not have prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease.

group.description: Gemcitabine (30 min intravenous infusion) dose of 1000mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle). Cisplatin (30-120 min intravenous infusion) dose of 35 mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle).

measure.title: Time to Progressive Disease
measure.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first date of disease progression.
measure.population: Efficacy Population: all enrolled participants who received study drug; did not have more than one neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; had measurable disease; had prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; and did not have prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease.

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first observation of disease progression, death as a result of any cause, or early discontinuation of treatment.
outcome.time_frame: first active treatment dose to last contact for patients, death as a result of any cause, or early discontinuation of treatment (eight 21-day cycles of therapy and follow-up period was 24 months starting from the date of the last drug administration.)
outcome.population: Efficacy Population: all enrolled participants who received study drug; did not have more than one neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; had measurable disease; had prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; and did not have prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease.

measure.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first observation of disease progression, death as a result of any cause, or early discontinuation of treatment.
measure.population: Efficacy Population: all enrolled participants who received study drug; did not have more than one neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; had measurable disease; had prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; and did not have prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease.

outcome.title: Survival Time
outcome.description: Overall survival is the duration from enrollment to death due to any cause.
outcome.time_frame: first active treatment dose to date of death due to any cause (eight 21-day cycles of therapy and follow-up period was 24 months starting from the date of the last drug administration.)
outcome.population: Efficacy Population: all enrolled participants who received study drug; did not have more than one neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; had measurable disease; had prior neoadjuvant/adjuvant chemotherapy; and did not have prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Maximum Common Toxicity Criteria-National Cancer Institute Toxicity (CTC-NCI) of Gemcitabine-Cisplatin Combination
outcome.description: The CTC provides descriptive terminology for adverse event reporting. A grading (severity) scale is provided for each adverse event term. Grades range from 0 (none) to 5 (death).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after last dose of study drug (eight 21-day cycles of therapy)
outcome.population: Safety Population: all enrolled participants who received study drug.

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine (30 min intravenous infusion) dose of 1000mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle). Cisplatin (30-120 min intravenous infusion) dose of 35 mg/m2 on Day 1 and Day 8 (21 day cycle).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Maximum Common Toxicity Criteria-National Cancer Institute Toxicity (CTC-NCI) of Gemcitabine-Cisplatin Combination
measure.description: The CTC provides descriptive terminology for adverse event reporting. A grading (severity) scale is provided for each adverse event term. Grades range from 0 (none) to 5 (death).
measure.population: Safety Population: all enrolled participants who received study drug.

outcome.description: Maximum CTC-NCI toxicity grade for hematology. Grades range from 0 (none) to 5 (death).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 30 days after last dose of study drug (eight 21-day cycles of therapy)
outcome.population: Safety Population: all enrolled participants who received study drug.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
